TF036039-ECA REGION - ECA BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT,TF037721-ECA REGION - TELECOMMUNICATIONS,TF050182-DUTCH COFINANCING, GEORGIA -
            SAC 3, 2ND TRANCHE

abstracts.cdata!:
The Third Structural Adjustment Credit
            (SAC3) to the Republic of Georgia had a satisfactory outcome
            and a modest institutional development impact.  Project
            sustainability is unlikely, with satisfactory performances
            by both the Bank and the Borrower.  While SAC3 conditions
            were implemented, they did not have the desired impacts
            because of the poor governance environment. A number of
            external factors inhibited the impact of the SAC3 including:
            the Russian crisis of 1998; the presidential elections of
            2000; and rising tensions over border security issues in
            2002.  The Government has always supported the program, and
            has been willing to intervene where implementing agencies
            caused snags in implementation. Lessons learned include the
            following.  SAC3 would have been better served by a
            technical assistance project that supported not only
            discrete activities, but aimed at true capacity building.
            An operation with a significantly longer implementation time
            would have better suited the Georgian reform programs.  The
            Bank needs to be more realistic in estimating implementation
            time, particularly for a three tranche operation with many
            conditions.  The Bank needs to spend more time raising
            ownership of the program at the level of implementing
            agencies.  Finally, the quality of governance may dictate
            the impact and the sustainability of the operation.
